text: Gérard Albert Mourou (born June 22, 1944) is a French scientist. He worked in electrical engineering and lasers. With Donna Strickland, he won the Nobel Prize in Physics for their co-invention of a technique called chirped pulse amplification, or CPA.Gérard Mourou Profile engin.umich.edu Retrieved 2 October 2018 In 1994, Mourou and his team at the University of Michigan discovered that the balance between Kerr effect and self-diffraction by ionization act as waveguides for the beam. ==References== ==Other websites== *Laboratoire d'Optique Appliquee *Ecole Polytechnique, Palaiseau *Center for Ultrafast Optical Science Category:1944 births Category:Living people Category:French physicists
